title: Chat summary (1-minute)
text: ChatGPT Chat History

title: Chat summary (1-minute)
text:
12 control artifacts (ship these into /architecture/)

ARCH-README.md â€“ Vision, scope, domain language, non-goals.
schema.yaml â€“ Content types (Theory/Example/Exercise/Glossary), fields, constraints, i18n, slugs.
urls.md â€“ Directory-style href policy, index.* resolution, slug immutability, language mapping.
openapi.yaml (or tRPC/proto) â€“ Public API, versions, error shapes.
events.md â€“ Editorial workflow & domain events (create/review/publish), payload schemas, versioning.
invariants.md â€“ Non-negotiables (e.g., directory hrefs only; i18n coverage; titles must exist; object-form leaf text as fallback; inline HTML in titles preserved).
adr/ â€“ Numbered Architecture Decision Records (Context â†’ Decision â†’ Consequences).
erd.mmd / diagram â€“ Entity relations (Mermaid/Draw.io) for DB + content relations.
security.md â€“ Roles, authN/Z rules, rate-limits, PII handling, threat checklist.
test-matrix.md â€“ Unit/contract/snapshot/acceptance; fixtures; coverage floor.
publishing-and-export.md â€“ Quarto/LaTeX/PDF parity rules, sidebar/TOC source of truth, link policy.
tooling-and-intent.md â€“ Codegen config, lint/typecheck rules, intent-header comment template, PR template pointers.


Why 12? Together they describe what must be true of Rhythmpedia across app, data, and publishingâ€”so AI can implement safely and CI can verify objectively.

title: Chat summary (1-minute)
section: 8 enforcement gates (CI must block on failure)
text:
8 enforcement gates (CI must block on failure)

Schema drift gate

Regenerate types/validators from schema.yaml (e.g., Prisma + Zod). Fail on diff.

API contract gate

Compare openapi.yaml vs main (e.g., openapi-diff); fail on breaking changes.

Invariants gate

Scripted checks for URL rules, i18n field presence, slug immutability, title required, inline-HTML allowed.

Dependency boundary gate

Enforce layer rules (e.g., depcruise/ESLint import rules).

Migration gate

Apply up then down on a fresh DB; fail on irreversibles or data-loss flags.

Tests & types gate

Run unit + contract + snapshot + acceptance; enforce coverage; TS typecheck.

Publishing parity gate

Build Quarto, verify sidebar/TOC, check directory-href links, dead links, missing titles.

Security & supply-chain gate

Secret scan, dependency audit (OSV/NPM), SAST lint, license allowlist.



Operating rule: If an invariant isnâ€™t enforced by a gate, it will be ignored. The artifacts document intent; the gates make it real.

title: Chat summary (1-minute)
text:
Optional Rhythmpedia defaults (quick start)

Invariants shortlist to seed invariants.md: directory-hrefs only Â· slug immutable Â· index.* â‡’ directory URL Â· titles required Â· i18n coverage required Â· object-form leaf text is fallback only Â· inline HTML in titles preserved Â· export parity with Quarto.

If you want, I can output a starter kit (all 12 files + CI skeleton) tailored to Rhythmpedia.

title: Chat summary (1-minute)
section: Related topics you might want next
text:
Related topics you might want next

â€œGenerate the 12 control artifacts with Rhythmpedia defaults.â€

â€œDraft 6 example ADRs (URLs, i18n model, events, security model, tests, exports).â€

title: Chat summary (1-minute)
section: Background that helps (even if not requested)
text:
Background that helps (even if not requested)

Treat prompts as executable design docs; keep them versioned and referenced in PRs.
Short loops win: change spec â†’ regen code â†’ run gates â†’ ship.
Make intent visible inside code: top-of-file intent headers (What/Why/Inputs/Outputs/Invariants/Risks).

section: Native-style rewrites of your original message

title: Cookie Policy
text:
1. About this policy
This Cookie Policy explains what cookies are, how we use them on this website, and how you can control their use.
We use Cookiebot to manage cookie consent in accordance with privacy laws in the EU/EEA, UK, Switzerland, and other regions where applicable.

title: Cookie Policy
text:
2. What are cookies?
Cookies are small text files placed on your device by websites you visit. They are widely used to make websites work, improve user experience, and provide certain information to the website owner.

title: Cookie Policy
text:
3. How we use cookies
We only use cookies for:

Advertising: Google AdSense cookies to serve relevant ads and limit repeated ads.

Functional purposes: Remembering your cookie preferences.
